author: Staff Reporter
text:
The bomb squad of the CID defusing the crude bombs recovered from a village in Birbhum, West Bengal, on Monday.— PHOTO: PTI

Six persons were injured in a blast in the Tiljala area on the south-eastern fringes of the city early on Monday.

“The reason for the blast is yet to be ascertained and investigation is going on,” Deputy Commissioner (South East Division) Gaurav Sharma told The Hindu .

According to officials, some glass panes and wooden doors were damaged in the blast that took place in a slum at 3 a.m. “Extensive search was conducted but no explosive material could be found,” the police said.

80 crude bombs seized

The police seized 80 crude bombs from the house of a Trinamool Congress (TMC) worker in Birbhum district on Sunday night. Locals said the house situated in the Banagram area, belonged to TMC worker Saroj Ghosh, and was abandoned since he had been out of the village for several years due to faction feuds in the ruling party.

“Mr. Ghosh belongs to the faction of local MLA Gadadhar Hazra and perhaps the bombs were put in his house by the rival faction of the TMC,” the local residents said.

The Superintendent of Police, Birbhum, Mukesh Kumar, said there had been no arrests in the case so far. “We have registered a case against unknown persons and investigation is going on,” he added. The bombs have been defused.
title: 6 injured in Kolkata blast
